title: Legal News for Fire Departments: Updates on Property Tax Levies and EMS Regulations
summary: The newsletter discusses legal updates related to property tax levies in fire departments, including limitations imposed by various statutes such as RCW 52.16 and 84.52. It also covers EMS levies, prorationing methods under the Lid laws, and constitutional limits on property taxes.

key_findings: Property tax levies are subject to strict limitations imposed by statutes.
EMS levies have specific provisions under state and local laws.
Lid laws impose a 106% lid on property tax increases.
Prorationing methods are used to adjust levies within constitutional limits.
Local taxing districts must adhere to state constitutional limits.
recommendations: Fire departments should ensure compliance with property tax limitations set by statutes.
Adherence to EMS levy provisions as outlined in state regulations is crucial for accurate calculations.
Local taxing districts must carefully follow Lid laws to prevent revenue growth over permissible limits.
Proper prorationing methods should be employed to adjust levies within constitutional constraints.
Regular audits and compliance checks with local governing bodies are essential.
